stories.story: I’ll never forget the night I debugged that impossible memory leak with my son. He was just starting out, and we sat side by side, tracing lines of code until sunrise. I explained my process, he challenged my assumptions, and together we found the culprit—a single misplaced pointer. We celebrated with cold pizza and laughter. That night, I realized he’d become a real engineer, and I felt a quiet pride I still carry.

There was a night, years ago, when my son and I hunted down a nasty bug in some code. We worked late, side by side, tracing through lines, talking through logic. He spotted something I missed—a pointer, I think. We fixed it, laughed, and ate cold pizza. That’s when I knew he was really growing into the craft.
I remember working late with my son, fixing a bug. We went through code, line by line. He found the mistake—a pointer, maybe. We laughed, ate pizza. It was a good night.
There was a night with my son. We worked on code. He found something I missed. We fixed it. Ate pizza. I remember feeling proud.
Night. My son and I. Code. Bug. Fixed it. Pizza.
